hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Masud regarding the verse 'Do not raise your voice in your prayer nor lower it excessively': He (Abdullah) said, 'He did not speak in low voice - one who made his two ears hear it.'

narrators.name: Al-Aswad ibn Hilal
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Shubah al-Kufi, Abu Shubah al-Iraqi

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn Masud
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Masud ibn Ghafil al-Hamdani

Topics: Interpretation of the Quranic verse about voice in supplication
Description of appropriate vocal volume in prayer

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Aisha regarding the verse 'Do not raise your voice in your prayer nor lower it excessively': She said, 'This is in supplication.'

narrators.name: Hisham ibn Urwah
narrators.full_name: Hisham ibn Urwah ibn al-Zubayr al-Asadi

Topics: Interpretation of the Quranic verse about voice in supplication
Application of voice modulation in supplication to Allah

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated that when Mujahid saw people supplicating with raised voices, he would strike them with pebbles and interpret the verse 'Do not raise your voice in your prayer nor lower it excessively.'

potential_issues.issue: Abu Hashim has limited biographical information in classical sources
potential_issues.impact: While the chain remains generally acceptable, the limited documentation on Abu Hashim introduces slight uncertainty about his full reliability profile

Topics: Incident of Mujahid's practice of correcting those who raised their voices in supplication
Interpretation of the Quranic verse on voice modulation in prayer

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ibrahim al-Hajari from Abu Ayyad saying, 'It is supplication.' Similar narration from Ubayd from Ibrahim. Similar narration from Salim from Ataa.

chainIssues: Second chain is shorter and appears to be a parallel transmission
Third chain is parallel transmission with similar narrators

potential_issues.issue: Salim ibn Abi Salim has received criticism from some scholars regarding reliability
potential_issues.impact: The third chain through Salim is slightly weaker than the others, though his narrations are generally accepted by many scholars

Topics: Multiple interpretations of the Quranic verse about voice modulation in prayer
Consensus among early scholars that the verse refers to supplication

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ibrahim regarding the verse 'And he had from the lowness of it no ally': He said, 'He had no ally nor helper from his creation.'
Topics: Interpretation of the Quranic verse from Surah al-Isra about Allah's perfect attribute of being without need of any ally

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas that he asked Kaab regarding the verse 'Indeed, those of the Cave and al-Raqim were among Our signs': Kaab said, 'It is the village.'

narrators.name: Simak ibn Harb
reliabilityIssues: Some scholars considered him weak in hadith science

narrators.name: Ikrimah
reliabilityIssues: Known to have reported from Ibn Abbas through indirect channels sometimes

narrators.name: Ibn Abbas
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib

chainIssues: Simak ibn Harb is considered weak (saduq) in his reporting. Ikrimah's transmission from Ibn Abbas is generally acceptable but sometimes reports via indirect means

potential_issues.issue: Simak ibn Harb has been criticized by scholars as being weak in hadith transmission and reliability
potential_issues.impact: The presence of Simak as the first narrator in the chain weakens the overall reliability of this hadith, despite the strength of the remaining narrators

potential_issues.issue: Ikrimah sometimes reports from Ibn Abbas through indirect transmission
potential_issues.impact: While Ikrimah is generally acceptable, the use of 'an (from) introduces slight ambiguity, though it is not a critical issue for this chain

Topics: Incident of Ibn Abbas asking Kaab al-Ahbar about the interpretation of the People of the Cave verse
Identification of al-Raqim in the Quranic verse about the People of the Cave

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Abu Husayn from Said ibn Jubayr regarding the verse 'Which is better in food': He said, 'That which is more lawful in food.' And from Abu Husayn from Ikrimah: He said, 'That which is more abundant in food.'

narrators.name: Ikrimah
reliabilityIssues: Sometimes reports from Ibn Abbas through indirect channels

potential_issues.issue: Both chains start with Abu Husayn who is graded as Saduq, not thiqah
potential_issues.impact: The hadiths through Abu Husayn are of moderate reliability rather than the highest grade

Topics: Interpretation of the Quranic verse regarding food in the story of the People of the Cave
Tafsir discussion about which food quality is superior

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Mansur from Ibrahim regarding the verse 'Keep yourself with those who call upon their Lord morning and evening desiring His countenance': He said, 'The five prayers.' And from Mansur from Mujahid likewise.
Topics: Interpretation of Quranic verse about keeping company with those who remember Allah
Identification of morning and evening prayer with the five daily prayers

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Abdullah ibn Muslim ibn Hurmuz from Said ibn Jubayr regarding the verse 'The righteous deeds that remain': He said, 'The five prayers.' And the companions of Abdullah used to recite it as if they expected to meet Him.

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn Muslim ibn Hurmuz
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muslim ibn Hurmuz al-Thaqafi

potential_issues.issue: Abdullah ibn Muslim ibn Hurmuz is graded as Saduq, not at the highest reliability level
potential_issues.impact: The chain reliability is reduced due to this narrator being of moderate grade rather than thiqah

Topics: Interpretation of the Quranic verse about righteous deeds that remain
Identification of righteous deeds with the five daily prayers
Explanation of the verse about the anticipation of meeting Allah

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Abu Husayn from Said ibn Jubayr regarding the verse 'And there was beneath it a treasure for them': He said, 'Knowledge.' And from Ibn Abi Najih from Mujahid likewise.

chainIssues: Second chain has Ibn Abi Najih who is graded Saduq, not the highest reliability

potential_issues.issue: Both chains start with narrators graded as Saduq
potential_issues.impact: The overall reliability of this hadith is reduced due to the presence of moderately reliable narrators at the beginning of both chains

Topics: Interpretation of the Quranic verse regarding the treasure beneath the cave
Tafsir explaining that the treasure refers to knowledge, not material wealth

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Abu Husayn from Ikrimah regarding the verse 'And there was beneath it a treasure for them': He said, 'Wealth.'

narrators.name: Ikrimah
reliabilityIssues: Sometimes reports from Ibn Abbas through indirect channels

potential_issues.issue: Both narrators in the chain are graded as Saduq, not at the highest reliability level
potential_issues.impact: The chain has moderate reliability due to both narrators being graded Saduq

Topics: Interpretation of the Quranic verse regarding the treasure beneath the cave
Tafsir explaining that the treasure refers to wealth/material treasure

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Mansur from Hilal ibn Yasaf from Mus'ab ibn Sa'd from Sa'd regarding the verse 'The losers are those whose deeds in this life go astray': He said, 'The people of the monasteries.'

narrators.name: Mus'ab ibn Sa'd
narrators.full_name: Mus'ab ibn Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas al-Ansari

chainIssues: Two narrators in the middle of the chain (Hilal and Mus'ab) are graded as Saduq

potential_issues.issue: Hilal ibn Yasaf and Mus'ab ibn Sa'd are both graded as Saduq, not at the highest reliability level
potential_issues.impact: The presence of two moderately reliable narrators in the chain reduces the overall authenticity grade despite the strong narrator at the end (Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas)

Topics: Interpretation of the Quranic verse about those whose deeds are lost
Tafsir identifying the people of monasteries as those whose deeds will be lost

hadiths.english_translation: That Ibn al-Kawaai asked Ali ibn Abi Talib regarding the verse 'The losers are those whose deeds go astray': He said, 'They are the people of Harura.'

narrators.name: Ali ibn Abi Talib
narrators.full_name: Ali ibn Abi Talib ibn Abd al-Muttalib

chainIssues: Transmission via 'ann (أنّ) indicating indirect reporting of the narrative

potential_issues.issue: The hadith is transmitted via 'anna' (أنّ) indicating it may be a mursal or indirect transmission from Ibn al-Kawaai
potential_issues.impact: The use of 'anna' suggests the narrator is reporting indirectly about what Ibn al-Kawaai asked Ali, which weakens the direct connection of the isnad

hadiths.IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Interpretation of Quranic verse about those whose deeds are wasted
Incident of Ibn al-Kawaai's inquiry to Ali about the verse

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from al-A'mash from Shamr ibn Atiyyah from Abu Yahya from Kaab ibn Ujrah: 'A man will be brought on the Day of Resurrection and will not weigh the wing of a mosquito, then he recited: We will not set for them any weight on the Day of Resurrection.'

narrators.name: Al-A'mash
reliabilityIssues: Known as a mudallis (Category 2 - generally accepted)

narrators.name: Abu Yahya
narrators.full_name: Ali ibn Nufayl ibn Zara al-Jahani

chainIssues: Al-A'mash is known as a mudallis (Category 2) using 'an transmission

potential_issues.issue: Al-A'mash is a Category 2 mudallis using 'an transmission, though he is generally accepted
potential_issues.impact: While Al-A'mash is reliable despite his tadlis, the use of 'an is worth noting in the chain analysis

potential_issues.issue: Multiple narrators in the chain are graded as Saduq (moderately reliable)
potential_issues.impact: The chain does not reach the highest level of reliability due to the presence of moderate-grade narrators

Topics: Quranic interpretation regarding the weightlessness of disbelievers' deeds on the Day of Judgment
Description of the state of disbelievers on the Day of Resurrection

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from al-Rabi ibn Abi Rashid from Said ibn Jubayr regarding the verse 'Whoever hopes for the meeting of his Lord': He said, 'The reward of his Lord.'

potential_issues.issue: Al-Rabi ibn Abi Rashid is graded as Saduq with limited biographical information
potential_issues.impact: The presence of al-Rabi with moderate reliability reduces the chain to Hasan rather than Sahih

Topics: Interpretation of the Quranic verse about hoping for the meeting of the Lord
Tafsir defining 'meeting the Lord' as 'reward from the Lord'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from al-Rabi ibn Abi Rashid from Said ibn Jubayr regarding the verse 'Whoever hopes for the meeting of his Lord and whose reward from the Lord is better and does righteous deed and does not join in worship with his Lord anyone': He said, 'Does not show off.'

potential_issues.issue: Al-Rabi ibn Abi Rashid is graded as Saduq with limited biographical information
potential_issues.impact: The presence of al-Rabi with moderate reliability reduces the chain to Hasan rather than Sahih

Topics: Interpretation of multiple Quranic verses from Surah al-Kahf about sincerity in worship
Tafsir explaining that sincerity means not showing off in deeds

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Husayn from Ismail ibn Rashid from Said ibn Jubayr from Ibn Abbas regarding the verse 'Kaf Ha Ya Ain Sad': He said, 'Mighty, Great, Guide, Trustworthy, Mighty, Truthful.' And from Musa ibn Abi Aisha from Ibn Abbas likewise except he placed instead of Great and Guide, Mighty Guide.

narrators.name: Ibn Abbas
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib

chainIssues: Husayn is majhul (unknown) and Ismail ibn Rashid is majhul al-hal (unknown condition)

narrators.name: Ibn Abbas
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib

potential_issues.issue: First chain contains Husayn who is majhul (unknown) and Ismail ibn Rashid who is majhul al-hal
potential_issues.impact: The first chain is significantly weakened due to unknown narrators, making this chain problematic

potential_issues.issue: Second chain is stronger with Musa ibn Abi Aisha who is Saduq, providing a better alternative transmission
potential_issues.impact: The hadith has support from the second chain which is more reliable

Topics: Interpretation of the abbreviations in Surah Maryam (Kaf Ha Ya Ain Sad)
Tafsir explaining the meaning of the Quranic abbreviations as Divine attributes

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ibn Abi Najih from Mujahid regarding the verse 'And I fear the relatives after me': He said, 'The family.' Regarding the verse 'He will inherit from me and will inherit from the family of Jacob': He will inherit from me the wealth and will inherit from the family of Jacob the prophecy.

potential_issues.issue: Ibn Abi Najih is graded as Saduq with some scholars questioning his reliability
potential_issues.impact: The presence of Ibn Abi Najih with moderate reliability reduces the chain to Hasan rather than Sahih

Topics: Interpretation of Quranic verses from Surah Maryam about inheritance
Tafsir explaining material inheritance versus prophetic inheritance

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ibn Abi Najih from Mujahid regarding the verse 'And he found from among them a woman who rules them': He said, 'Over them in judgment and authority.'

potential_issues.issue: Ibn Abi Najih is graded as Saduq
potential_issues.impact: Moderate reliability rather than highest grade

Topics: Interpretation of Quranic verse about the Queen of Sheba ruling her people
Tafsir explaining female authority and leadership in judgment

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated that Ibn Abbas was asked about a verse, and Ikrimah said something regarding it.
Topics: Tafsir commentary from Ibn Abbas regarding a Quranic verse

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ibn Jurayj from Abdullah ibn Uthman from Ibn Abbas regarding a verse with tafsir.

narrators.name: Ibn Jurayj
narrators.full_name: Abd al-Malik ibn Abd al-Aziz ibn Jurayj

chainIssues: Ibn Jurayj is a known mudallis (Category 3) using 'an transmission

potential_issues.issue: Ibn Jurayj is a Category 3 mudallis using 'an transmission
potential_issues.impact: The reliability is reduced due to potential indirect transmission from this mudallis

Topics: Tafsir from Ibn Abbas via Ibn Jurayj

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from an unnamed man from Mujahid regarding the verse about the palm tree and Mary.

chainIssues: First narrator is unnamed and completely unknown

potential_issues.issue: First narrator is unnamed and majhul (completely unknown)
potential_issues.impact: This is a critical issue making the hadith problematic due to unknown narrator in the chain

Topics: Tafsir about the palm tree and Mary in Surah Maryam

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Jabir from Mujahid regarding the verse about the palm tree trunk.

potential_issues.issue: Jabir is graded as Saduq, not highest reliability
potential_issues.impact: Chain has moderate reliability due to Jabir's grade

Topics: Tafsir about the palm tree trunk in the Maryam narrative

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Jabir from Mujahid regarding the verse 'Would that I had died before this.'

potential_issues.issue: Jabir is graded as Saduq, not highest reliability
potential_issues.impact: Chain has moderate reliability due to Jabir's grade

Topics: Tafsir about Mary's wish regarding her death in Surah Maryam

hadiths.english_translation: Continuation of tafsir regarding Mary in Surah Maryam.
Topics: Tafsir about Mary in Surah Maryam continued

hadiths.english_translation: Tafsir about Mary continued.
Topics: Tafsir about Mary
